subject: History

overview.description: Comprehensive history curriculum that balances Malaysian history with global perspectives, emphasizing critical thinking, source analysis, and understanding historical connections to contemporary issues

learning_objectives: Understand Malaysian history within global historical contexts
Develop skills in historical source analysis and interpretation
Apply historical thinking to analyze cause and effect relationships
Connect historical knowledge to contemporary issues and challenges
Appreciate diverse perspectives and cultural contributions to history

units.title: Malaysia in the Age of Exploration and Trade
learning_outcomes: Understand Malaysia's role in global trade networks
Analyze the impact of external influences on local societies
Evaluate the transformation of traditional kingdoms
Compare Malaysian experiences with other Southeast Asian regions

lessons.title: The Malacca Sultanate in Global Context
objectives: Understand Malacca's strategic position in global trade
Analyze the multicultural nature of Malaccan society

activities.description: Analyze trade route maps showing Malacca's global connections
Examine accounts from Chinese, Arab, and European traders
Compare Malacca with contemporary trading cities worldwide
Discuss Malacca's influence on modern Malaysian society

resources: Primary source documents from multiple perspectives
cross_curricular_connections: Geography: Trade routes and monsoon patterns
Economics: Historical trade systems and currency

units.title: Colonialism and Resistance in Global Perspective
learning_outcomes: Compare colonial experiences across different regions
Analyze various forms of resistance to colonial rule
Evaluate the impact of colonial policies on societies
Understand the global context of decolonization movements

lessons.title: British Colonial Policies: Malaysia and Global Comparisons
objectives: Compare colonial policies in Malaysia with other colonies
Analyze the economic impact of colonial rule

activities.description: Create comparative charts of colonial policies across regions
Analyze specific colonial policies and their impacts
Role-play different stakeholder perspectives on colonial policies
Connect colonial legacies to contemporary issues

resources: Comparative case studies from different colonies
cross_curricular_connections: Economics: Colonial economic systems and trade

units.title: Independence Movements and Nation Building
learning_outcomes: Understand the development of Malaysian nationalism
Compare independence movements across different countries
Analyze challenges in post-independence nation building
Evaluate Malaysia's role in regional and international affairs

lessons.title: Malaysian Independence in Global Context
objectives: Understand the process of Malaysian independence
Analyze factors contributing to peaceful transition

activities.description: Create parallel timelines of independence movements globally
Simulate independence negotiations with different stakeholders
Compare Malaysian independence with other nations
Reflect on the lasting impact of independence agreements

units.title: Malaysia in the Modern World
learning_outcomes: Analyze Malaysia's role in international organizations
Evaluate challenges and achievements in nation building
Connect historical development to contemporary global issues

lessons.title: Malaysia's Economic Development and Transformation
objectives: Analyze development policies and their impacts
Compare Malaysia's development with other emerging economies

activities.description: Analyze economic data showing Malaysia's development trajectory
Evaluate major development policies and their effectiveness
Compare Malaysia's development with other Asian nations
Discuss implications for Malaysia's future development

summative_assessments: Unit examinations with essay and source analysis (45%)
Research project on chosen historical topic (25%)
